It got to the point where I had to ask a busser for a refill.  After we got our refill that was it.  We did not get another glance or anything until she came by to collect the plates...I had to ask her for another refill for my daughter and although the rest of us wanted refills too it was like forget it...Anyway she acknowledged that she was going to get a refill and even took my daughter's cup....and NEVER came back until it was time to pass out the tab.  She never looked at me, just handled the bill to my friend and left.  We were at the restaurant for an hour and 35 minutes, we got our food in within the first 20 minutes and spent the rest of the time waiting...for her.  She never asked if we wanted more chips and salsa, she never asked us if the food was okay, she never asked for refills after that first round and needed to be "asked" if we could have refills, never asked if we wanted water (perhaps that would have been easier and faster to refill????) and then we waited to get the bill and then my friend waited to pay.  YIKES!  I've never been treated that poorly there since tonight.  I mean there were a few other times where service was slow but not that bad.  In any event...idk I was just so upset and disappointed.  I don't think I would go there again...If more than 50% of the time I went there the food and/or service was good I would say meh...chalk it up to a "bad night" and plan on going back but because the food nor the service is anything that totally blows my hair back...I can do without it.  Maybe if I were 21 and diggin' on the sports and alcohol then this would be the perfect place for me.  Unfortunately, I'm not.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer I.
Reviews.Content: I love Jose's which is why I'm surprised it has so many bad reviews.  The service is always good when we go there.  And I love, love their food.  First of all they give free chips and salsa.  I think it should be mandatory that all mexican places give free chips and salsa.  The salsa is spicy but not overpowering.  I've tried a lot of items on the menu but my favorite is their chicken chimichanga.  It's super tasty, and is fried perfectly.  My bf usually gets their carnitas, which he says are amazing.  I also like their burritos, especially the jai.  The portions are pretty large so I can never finish a burrito or chimichanga in 1 sitting.

Reviews.Author: Dan B.
Reviews.Content: The food wasn't as tasty as I thought. It is overpriced. You can tell by the amount of people on a Friday night, restaurant less than half full. What turned me off completely, when one of the workers coming out of the kitchen going to the bathroom, used the restroom and DID NOT WASH HIS HANDS, GROSS!!! Will never go back again.

Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: Kate our waitress was the best!

Reviews.Author: Krysten I.
Reviews.Content: $12 for 3 tacos. I loaded them with salsa and salt because they taste like nothing if you don't. Not much else to say...The food is not worth the price and the service is just okay. MEH. I've definitely experienced better.

Reviews.Author: J K.
Reviews.Content: What the heck happened to this place??  Their menu is totally different now.  My husband and I ordered take out from there since we know how awesome the service is.  His all time fav is the Burrito Del Mar.  They changed the sauce it used to come with and now make it with ranchera sauce.  Tasted weird with the crab!  The sauce was so strong it took away the flavor from the crab. I still love their chips and salsa though, but then again how can you mess up chips and salsa??

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: EPIC FAIL!!! The service was so super slow and terrible, waited for 40 minutes for the food to come out and it wasn't that great...the chips and salsa they brought out initially was stale and definately from a jar, I could've eaten that at home!!!  After waiting over 15 for our bill (which never came) we ended up leaving $20 on the table and walking out...

Reviews.Author: Mila S.
Reviews.Content: I am so surprised at these negative reviews! I really like Jose's. The menu is extensive and has some really unique options, like crab and spinach. The servers are really friendly and service is good. They also give free chips and salsa, and I don't think you can knock them for the salsa being too hot for your taste... they do have a mild version that you can request. Oh, and the margaritas and great, as well! I'll continue to come back.

Reviews.Author: London F.
Reviews.Content: I have literally grown up eating at Jose's.  I remember being young enough where I was crawling under the tables!  Jose's is a small family owned restaurant.  It was run by two sisters, some brothers? and their father, from what I remember.  I always remember their food was excellent and our favorite thing to order was always the con queso.  At some point, they opened a second location in Restaurant Row.  Not sure if it's still there, but at that point, new cooks and staff were brought into this location and I never saw the family here anymore.  I have seen them at the new location.  Anyway, the food isn't as good as I remember growing up.  It is probably due to new cooks making and preparing the food.  I will probably still eat here once in a blue moon, but I'm never excited to eat here like I used to be.  The food is nothing special.On a positive note, the servers are always friendly.  Keep in mind the parking here is metered parking so bring some quarters!

Reviews.Author: Marc E.
Reviews.Content: Food is good but tryng to find a waitress is tough. We waited for awhile at door until hostesses sitting at their own table finally noticed us. The waitress went back to sitting at the table where she couldn't see customers and they can't see her. Cook came out at end of meal with cigerrette hanging out of his mouth. Too bad the employees are chasing out the customers.

Reviews.Author: Tyrone H.
Reviews.Content: I've been a regular for six years. The service is great. The Margarita's are tasty. The place is a long way from Mexico, so the food isn't straight out of mazatlan, neither is the food from any other Mexican restaurant in the islands  but the owners are actually Mexican, so you know the staples are worthy. Good salsa, enchiladas,  and conversation. If there are people at the bar, join them, they love company.

Reviews.Author: Badbeans W.
Reviews.Content: As a mainland visitor to Honolulu I was seeking some Mexican food to take a break from traditional food found on the islands. I went to Jose's Cafe and Cantina for lunch. The chips are salsa are free, which is expected at a Mexican restaurant. However, I found the chips to be overcooked and stale. I had the lunch special of a chicken burrito with beans and rice. The food was alright, but it wasn't great. I ate it and was like "meh". The beans and rice were also not bad, but not good. The waitress was very nice and helpful. I likely won't return to this restaurant in the future.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: Parking can be convenient. That's the best part of Jose's. Everything is dated--the interior, the food, and the bad service. Authentic?  Nope. But does it at least taste good?  Not really. Come here for 80s style microwave fake cheese laden "food".  Maybe I spent too much time in LA where there are real choices for authentic (and even regional!) Mexican food.

Reviews.Author: Tessa t.
Reviews.Content: yelp 365 challenge #26/365chorizo con huevossoooo gooood!!eggs were cooked perfectly!! not runny at all :)chimichanga...good...i didn't like the beef too much...salsa and chips. yum.service...well, she checked up on us every 5 minutes...literally...but maybe it's cuz we were the only table there...

Reviews.Author: matt s.
Reviews.Content: I would give Jose's 4 stars if it weren't a bit pricey--about 16 for plate.  Their spinach burrito with chicken are my go meal here, and I love it.  Parking is metered off street.  It's limited, but I've never had a problem finding a spot.  It's funny that the biggest complaint I've read is the service.  The last two times I've gone, I was laughing hysterically about how often the waitresses checked in on us.  It was border-line obsessive.  Maybe they've started to read the reviews on here and adjusting . . .

Reviews.Author: Jennie E.
Reviews.Content: Not too shabby. Staff was friendly. Salsa excellently spicy! The beans and enchilada muey born! Loved the cooking of the taco and the meat but there was only one inch of meat! Ugh!!! Tecate is ice cold and there is a full bar which makes me smile!!! Decor is, uh, leaves a Mexican food lover wondering ... overall because of the majority of food and staff a YES!

Reviews.Author: Chelsea U.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Wednesday night and was not crowded at all. The service was quick and pleasant and the food was not bad. The chips and salsa were good, salsa is pretty spicy! I ordered the Enchiladas Suizas, chicken enchiladas with ranchero sauce, rice, and beans. Nothing special, but delicious. I also ordered a blended li hing margarita. It melted pretty quickly, but was still good.

Reviews.Author: Betsy P.
Reviews.Content: I heart Jose's! True, I love pinto beans and only eat tostadas and burritos but I LOVE their beans! And their margaritas kick some serious booty! I get mine with fresh squeezed lime juice not that processed crap. I am from New Mexico and grew up in LA so I know all about Mexican food :) Their beans are authentic and yummy, not bland at all! All these other negative reviewers must have a stick up their butt cuz Jose's rocks!

Reviews.Author: Rob T.
Reviews.Content: Met with some friends for pau hana. I love Mexican food and have been to some really good Mexican restaurants, but I just couldn't eat anymore after a few appetizer bites. Decided to stay safe and drink my imported beer instead. If anything good came out of this, it would be its chips and salsa.

Reviews.Author: Macy R.
Reviews.Content: Haters of this place must have hit Jose's on an off day, or I hit it on a great day! We were gonna go to Azteca, but they are closed on Sundays.  I had a very pleasant experience here.  Our short-haired waitress was oh-so friendly, not to mention, super cute. Our chicken taco salad was perfect for two.  The house chips and salsa, just perfect.  Coming from So Cal, this place made me feel right at home. For me, this is second to Serg's in Manoa. So, don't knock it until you try it.  Hasta luego!

Reviews.Author: Nicole Z.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I where driving through Kaimuki trying to decide on where to eat. We saw the 2 Mexican places on Waialae and decided we would go there but when we parked we found ourselves outside of Jose's and decided to try it out.  My boyfriend being for San Diego and part Mexican was a little hesitant.  Well I have to say WE WILL BE BACK!! The prices where a little high but for Mexican in Hawaii they all are.   The sizes of the meals were big enough to bring some home and make a second small meal so this made up for the price.  We did not get to enjoy any drinks but will have to check it out next time.  I had the veggie burrito with chicken added and the add prices where VERY reasonable!! The burrito was a new twist with the variety of veggies in it.  I very much enjoyed it. His choose two with of tamales and chicken tostada was completely cleared before we left and what wasn't was gone the next day quickly!!

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: The whole enchilada was filling yet wasn't very tasteful.  I think the best thing this place has to offer are the frozen margaritias.

Reviews.Author: Sean D.
Reviews.Content: Great authentic food!  Great service! Great atmosphere!Ok, so we came in fairly late on a friday night.  I work in the food and bev. industry and I know that is a bad thing to do.  However, I like to try new places with my special girl, we had this place in mind, I got off late, but we went for it.  We were very pleased to be greeted at the door and sat at a huge booth by a very freindly hostess.  She offered the signature margarita, told us how much she loved it, pointed out a few menu items and left us to ponder.The decor was anything you would see in Cabo or San Felipe, typical mexican busy dining atmosphere.  Because we arrived so late, the dining room was fairly empty, but the bar was seemingly the place to be.  Lots of guests having fun.  If we weren't here for a date night, we would have joined the crowd at the bar.The waitress (sorry I forget her name, Tracy?) greeted us with chips and salsa and pointed out her favorites on the menu.  I am not a huge salsa fan (my better half is) but I was eating it up.  Great tomato and cilantro mix with a little spice.  Chips seemed homemade, thick and airy.Margaritas came quick, I had the signature scratch, she had the pomegranate...both were very delicious.We started with sharing the meatball soup.  Holy moly...it was very tasty with large meatballs and a great broth.We ordered the Snow crab enchilada for her and the chicken enchilada for me.  Being somewhat of a foodie, my first test is the plate check.  I always touch the plate first to see if it is hot and will sustain the meal.  I guess I didn't need to as the waitress firmly stressed that the plates were very hot, and she was not joking.  The plates were searingly hot, and I expressed to my better half that this is a great sign to a great meal.Not sure how Jose's stays in business, her Crab enchilada was over stuffed with so much crab she could not believe.  She thought she won the lottery.  The flavor was well balanced with the beans and rice, and so much crab!  She is a crab fiend, and I think Jose took her down...she could not handle and we had to take some home (she enjoyed it twice!)Chicken enchiladas were very flavorful with lots of chicken and a great mix with all of the other flavors.We didn't think we had it in us, but we took a shot at the dessert menu.  We asked the waitress if we were keeping her, but she pointed at the bar and stated she will be there for a while.  We never felt rushed or hurried like she needed to leave.  We tried the flan and it was very tasty.  We thought we might take a few bites and take it home, but it was gone in a few minutes (tasted so good we were fighting for it).  It had a different texture and was thicker than what i am used to, seemed much more home made than what you get at other restaurants.  Perfect end to a great meal...get the flan!I would definately eat here again...the food and service were exceptional...the manager was very present in the dining room and touched our table quite a few times and thanked us as we left.  The bar seems like a happenning place and a great place to go for sports.  Next time I will probably bring some friends for some monday night football and margaritas.Only reason I gave it 4 stars is that we are not in mexico or southern cal...we are in Hawaii...but for being 3000 miles away....Jose's does mexican food well....

Reviews.Author: Les Is More M.
Reviews.Content: this place is well known to have arguably the best mexican food in town... at least until MEXICO restaurant opened up in kalihi.  but either way, good quality and the margaritas here are hard to beat.  I had one of the best margarita pitchers ever here, and even tipped the waitress and bartender, challenging them to make a second as good as the first.  sure enough, awesome.  now they don't offer the li hing margarita like mexico restaurant does, but there's something to be said for the more traditional menu selection.  parking is plentiful, and service has always been satisfactory the many times I've been here.  will definitely be back.  I just wish there was a mariachi band playing, instead of the run-of-the-mill staff that may give you the "I'm just working my way through college" vibe.  still, I'd go back again and/or suggest others try it.  I think mexico has an edge over menu selection and quality, but as I mentioned before, jose's has a more traditional menu.

Reviews.Author: L K.
Reviews.Content: My family & I took our Dad/Papa to dinner at Jose's for his 78th birthday & service was the worst I have ever experienced anywhere. It took a long time for someone to take a drink order & forever for us to receive our drinks. And the drink order to was wrong which I had to wait again. The server asked if we wanted chips & the chips came but without salsa & it is normally served with salsa. So, we asked for salsa & the server said, " oh yes it's in the back." Then, we never got it at all. My son ordered an appetizer & when another person delivered it she asked if we wanted plates & we responded yes & never got that until we waited so long that I had to get up & ask someone else for plates. We then ordered our food & waited, waited, waited, & waited with no explanation as to why our food was taking so long. We even ordered more drinks while waiting for food & we waited & waited for our drinks. Our food finally came 45 minutes later & when we started to eat, the server then told us that the kitchen was backed up. Okay, most times they would let us know the status of our food while the delay is happening ....NOT after the fact. Anyway, the restaurant was slow & we would have been fine if we didn't have to wait for our drinks & if the server gave us the status of our food. Just a reminder, we had a 78 year old & a 3 year old that needed to eat. Well, that's not the worst, the server dropped the check & within a minute was back to collect payment & that was the first time the whole night she had moved so quickly & attentively to our table. After looking over the bill an 18% gratuity was added & we did not believe she deserved the tips. My daughter asked to see the manager & told her about the service or should I say the lack of service we received & that the gratuity was not earned & we was not willing to pay that & maybe we would be willing to pay 15%. (Which my daughter should never had said.)Anyway, they took the 18% off & added 15% instead & we still did not agree with that.  It should have been left blank & up to our discretion. We did pay the bill but not without the server giving us her insincere apologies & her bad attitude. My daughter explained to her in a nice way that we would have been okay if she told us what was going on & being attentive instead of waiting to after the fact. The special occasion did not end up very special & the server deserved less than 10%. And my review is not to be demeaning but it is the fact & I have been to Jose's before & service was okay but this time it was terrible. Three of us on the table have been in the service industry for many years & I believe that sometimes people in the service industry forget that they work for TIPS & that is TO INSURE PROPER SERVICE.The one good thing about the restaurant was the food was good.

Reviews.Author: Puddytat C.
Reviews.Content: It's too Americanized.  Even the salsa isn't good.  Tried it several times to get a clear opinion and it's still the same.  Just not my type of Mexican food.  Lived in California and you really get to know good Mexican food.  This ain't even close.

Reviews.Author: Susan F.
Reviews.Content: so i've been meaning to go here for a while and finally found the time to do so.  bad move.  first off, the PRICES were RIDICULOUS, about 13-15 dollar average per plate, and the size of the portion was the same price a 7 dollar plate would cost anywhere else, just because they have one of the biggest mexican restaurants and the most servers doesnt mean you have to jack the price up.  Also, their drinks were damn expensive too, i think it was like 8 dollars for a margarita, also, you have to pay extra if you want more chips. deal breaker.  I've had worse tasting food,  but the prices just did it for me.

Reviews.Author: opqr s.
Reviews.Content: The absolute WORST service I have ever had!  I give the food a 1/2 star out of 5.  There are so many better Mexican restaurants on island to spend your money at.

Reviews.Author: Terri Q.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ate at Jose's last Friday which turned out to be a mistake.  It will be our last time.  When we arrived, the place was very busy and we were seated next to the bar.  Not a good idea, but we tried to make do.  Within a few minutes, a loud drunk looked at us and yelled, "losers"! then proceeded to giggle hysterically.  (My husband is a doctor and I am retired from the USAF.  Losers?  Really??)  I told our waitress what had happened and asked if we could be moved to another table.  She spoke to her manager and explained to us that the drunk was a regular, didn't mean what he said, etc.  It sounded like excuses to me and I wanted to leave.  I insisted that we be moved to another seat and she finally did so.  Why we weren't seated away from the bar in the first place didn't make sense to us since there were tables available on the other side.   We were able to have our meal in peace, but this experience has changed our minds about giving our business to Jose's in the future.I can only imagine what the staff from   "Restaurant Impossible" would have to say about the dark, dirty interior, the loud drunks, and the mediocre food.  We say "adios".

Reviews.Author: Alan N.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I didn't have the food but the margarita was Soooooo BAD there is no way I was going to try the EXTREMELY OVERPRICED Mexican food!  The portions looked HUGE, but who cares.  I sat at the bar and ordered a margarita of my choice which the frantic woman behind the bar said would be the same price as a "shot" of the Tequila I selected.  This didn't end up being true.  I ordered the "1800" which was listed as $6.50.  It was oddly, $3 more. ????  I wasn't offered chips and salsa which is rude in a truly authentic mexican restaurant.  It is Hawaii, but no bueno on this one.

Reviews.Author: Marcus J.
Reviews.Content: Bartenders are super cool if you want a place to chill at and have a beer, watch a little sports or talk about the news. Bartenders talk a little shit with you and you have a pretty good time.  Now the food on the other hand they can keep! Its over priced for the feel and atmosphere it could n should be cheaper. But hey! Don't let me stop you maybe it'll be yo shit.

Reviews.Author: Larry R.
Reviews.Content: Please people! Are we talking about the same Jose's in Kaimuki. Don't expect Tijuana... remember you live in Hawaii. Some of the bad reviews are just not justified. That being said, my wife and I go to Jose's once or twice a month. In fact we're going there on Cinco De Mayo on Wed. The Crab Enchilada are to kill for. We've tried other restaurants but not even close on these crab enchiladas. The tacos are fine too and so is the salsa. The waitresses are THE best!! ... loads or personality and smart too. Food is always pronto and hot. The atmosphere is not Mexico but charming, always fun and clean place to fix that Mexican feeding frenzi one has. Remember you're in Hawaii and its a bit TexMex but its good food. Parking is not great but timing is everything. I usually let my wife out first to get the table so when I get there she's already seated... no problemanto! Now bring on the cervezas!!!

Reviews.Author: Javier C.
Reviews.Content: The place is ok, and the food is ok....

Reviews.Author: Lena H.
Reviews.Content: my family and i went here on sunday for dinner.  the food took unusually long i would presume.  the rice was too salty and when our chips and salsa ran out she didn't offer to give us anymore (because we wanted some!) like other mexican restaurants would, but she offered us salsa???  oh yes, and i had fish tacos and i would not recommend them.  i could barely eat one and the fish wasn't the greatest.  the fish wasn't marrinated in a tasty sauce and if it was it wasn't good.  on the other hand the people were very nice.  i'd just wish that the food would be too!  i miss LA now thats great mexican food!

Reviews.Author: Adamah V.
Reviews.Content: I love mexican food, so much so that I'll even grind some Taco Bell when there's nothing of better quality around. Joses didn't quite make the grade though. I'll give the bartender a pass on the bad service because she seemed to be running the entire place herself with 4 tables and 3 bar patrons. The food was inexcusable though. My spanish rice came out like rice pudding because it was so over-cooked and the beans literally tasted rancid, after one bite it was hard to stomach. My actual Enchilada was decent though. I also ordered a queso dip but it was more like a soup, not really thick enough to dip anything into. So unless you're really desperate for some mexican food or a marharita and the two other mexican restaurants around the corner aren't open I wouldn't waste your time or money.

Reviews.Author: Rob E.
Reviews.Content: Terrible food and horrible prices.  Friend said his enchilada and taco plate tasted like a TV dinner.  My Taco salad had a bland tasting shredded beef - neither of us finished our meals.  Place came recommended too...won't be returning or recommending.  The bar and drinks must be the focus.

Reviews.Author: Jenny S.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this place.  I really did. It has cute decor and the server was helpful and sweet..........but the cheese/meat dip (dont remember the name) made me sick.  I never get sick from food.  I was sad.  Such a cute place.  But beware.

Reviews.Author: Sara H.
Reviews.Content: my fam ended up here on a sunday bc our usual mexican spot (aztecas) was closed.  food was decent (i had a veggie burrito but added chicken) but definitely not authentic (come on it's hawaii).  i think it's a little overpriced esp compared to aztecas which is right around the corner.  service was ok, a little slow when we first got there but better toward the end (perhaps bc it was late and they just wanted to get us out of there, since we were the last table...)  all in all, it was an ok experience.  the only reason i'd potentially go back is to try their margaritas!

Reviews.Author: Amy A.
Reviews.Content: Fun little spot. The food was ok - I had a taco salad that was decent. The shell it was in was AWESOME, though. Nice and flakey. My friend had the taquitos and she liked them.

Reviews.Author: Kanoe M.
Reviews.Content: Service was slow poor waitress was by herself. She actually apologized saying the cook was slow on the orders. And it was a pretty slow day.  Food was so-so.  So don't think I'll be back

Reviews.Author: Ane C.
Reviews.Content: The food was just OK and the prices are HIGH.

Reviews.Author: sharleen p.
Reviews.Content: i was thoroughly dissapointed with the service last week. I had started to go back there after several years and enjoyed the food however last week I took my daughter and encountered a waitress called Sarah.She took our order, broightnchips and salsa and the guacamole we ordered and did not check in again for one hour. I thought OK they are busy and was patient. She then came over and presented me with a check for my dinner THAT I NEVER GOT!!!!! There were two tables of 5 and 6 that got their dinner befire me that arrived at least15 minutes aftter we did, she told me that 'maybe she got my order in later than the other waitresses!"Clearly she forgot my order. When My order finally came(after90 minutes) i then ordered dessert without coconut-she brought that after 15 minutes and did it wrong. She again claimed that I did not tell her of the exception. By that time I was really upset. She comped me20% after she told me she would take care of the bill. I was so upset I left. I then called the manager on duty Sophie and she apologized and told me that she should have come over and speak to me but decided not to. She was going to give my name and number to the owner and give me a gcertificate or at least comp my meal. The owner has never returned my calls to this day.  I have never had such a bad experience at a restaurant and will never go there again.
